thread.title: All bark no bite on obesity - NZ First
thread.title_full: All bark no bite on obesity - NZ First

author: Fuseworks Media
title: All bark no bite on obesity - NZ First
text:
Fuseworks Media Tuesday, 20 October, 2015 - 09:57 
The government delivered a timid response instead of hard hitting, practical solutions to the country’s growing obesity rate, says New Zealand First. 
"There are no changes to the regulations around food advertising to children, or any initiative to help the 1.1 million New Zealand adults already overweight," says Health Spokesperson Barbara Stewart. "Instead obese four-year olds will just continue to be identified and pregnant mothers will be told to eat less. 
"What was needed was for government to take a stand in the war on obesity and change the environmental factors that contribute to New Zealand’s obesity epidemic. This has not happened. 
"New Zealand First would remove GST from healthy foods as only this initiative would encourage Kiwi families to choose healthy eating options and lead healthier lifestyles - without burdening poorer New Zealanders with more taxes. 
"If this is all government can produce in the fight against obesity than they have already lost," says Mrs Stewart.
